about.summary: Functions to fit Gaussian linear model by maximising the residual log likelihood where the covariance structure can be written as a linear combination of known matrices.  Can be used for multivariate models and random effects models.  Easy straight forward manner to specify random effects models, including random interactions. Code now optimised to use Sherman Morrison Woodbury identities for matrix inversion in random effects models. We've added the ability to fit models using any kernel as well as a function to return the mean and covariance of random effects conditional on the data (BLUPs).

name: r-regress
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.3-15" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-regress
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: regress_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/regress_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/regress/regress_{{ version }}.tar.gz

  sha256: 270356c2527e066482b38b02adfc5728864829aa4c642af4b72857964806f9b1

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1003

  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - r-base

  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('regress')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('regress')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/regress/index.html
  license: GPL
  summary: Functions to fit Gaussian linear model by maximising the residual log likelihood where the covariance structure can be written as a linear combination of known matrices.  Can be used for multivariate models and random effects models.  Easy straight forward manner to specify random effects models, including random
    interactions. Code now optimised to use Sherman Morrison Woodbury identities for matrix inversion in random effects models. We've added the ability to fit models using any kernel as well as a function to return the mean and covariance of random effects conditional on the data (BLUPs).
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - dpryan79
    - MathiasHaudgaard
    - FrodePedersen
    - ArneKr
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
